title: Jake Paul v Tommy Fury: Briton wins grudge match by split decision
description: Tommy Fury beat Jake Paul by split decision in arguably the most anticipated eight-round contest in boxing history.

title: Britishvolt bought by Australian firm Recharge Industries
description: Recharge Industries will pay £4bn for Britishvolt, the start-up that collapsed in January.

title: NI Protocol: 'Final talks' due between Rishi Sunak and Ursula von der Leyen
description: The EU's Ursula von der Leyen will be in the UK on Monday for face-to-face talks with PM Rishi Sunak.

title: Labour says UK risks falling behind Poland
description: Sir Keir Starmer says that without new policies, living standards will fall below those in eastern Europe.

title: Manchester United 2-0 Newcastle: Erik ten Hag is the transformative manager the Red Devils have craved

title: Viaplay Cup final: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou eyes 'special season'
description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou has his sights on a "special season" after his side beat Rangers for Viaplay Cup success.

title: Man Utd win Carabao Cup: Bruno Fernandes says winning League Cup is not enough for Red Devils
description: Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes says "we want more and need more" trophies after the 2-0 Carabao Cup final win over Newcastle United.

title: Israel and Palestinians pledge to reduce violence
description: As rare talks were held in Jordan, a Palestinian gunman killed two Israelis in the occupied West Bank.

title: Six Nations 2023: France 32-21 Scotland - analysis of Paris epic
description: Scotland put in their "best performance of the season" against France, according to head coach Gregor Townsend, but small margins mean their Grand Slam hopes are over.

title: Sam Kerr: Chelsea boss Emma Hayes hails 'best in the business' striker after goal in 100th game
description: Boss Emma Hayes praises striker Sam Kerr as the "best in the business" as Chelsea continue their recent dominance over Arsenal with a 2-0 victory in the Women's FA Cup fifth round.

title: Watch David De Gea's best Manchester United saves as he sets clean sheet record
description: Watch the best moments from David De Gea's Manchester United career as he surpasses Peter Schmeichel by setting a new record of 181 clean sheets for the club.

title: Omagh police shooting: Court extends detention of 43-year-old

description: Watch highlights as France keep their Six Nations title hopes alive with a hard-fought 32-21 win over Scotland in Paris.

title: Cup final: Mass brawl outside Hampden ahead of kick-off
description: Police said the disturbance took place about six hours before Rangers and Celtic were due to kick-off.

title: France end Scotland's Grand Slam hopes in Paris epic
description: France puncture Scotland's rising belief and restore their own Six Nations title hopes with a hard-fought win in an astonishing game in Paris.

description: Kyogo Furuhashi scores twice as Celtic get the better of Old Firm rivals Rangers at a tumultuous Hampden to retain the Viaplay Cup.

description: Rated the players out of 10 for Man Utd v Newcastle in Carabao Cup final.

description: Australia beat South Africa by 19 runs to win the Women's T20 World Cup for the third successive time.

title: Chelsea 2-0 Arsenal: Kerr scores in 100th game as Blues progress in Women's FA Cup
description: Sam Kerr scored her 82nd goal in 100 Chelsea appearances as the Blues beat Arsenal at Kingsmeadow to reach the quarter-finals of the Women's FA Cup

title: Northern Ireland Protocol: Announcement about Brexit deal imminent
description: The deputy prime minister earlier said the UK was close to securing a deal with the European Union.

title: Tottenham Hotspur 2-0 Chelsea: Harry Kane goal seals win for hosts

title: Olivia Newton-John: Australia celebrates 'force of nature' performer
description: Sir Elton John is among the celebrities who paid tribute to the late actress at a special event.

title: Social housing bosses could need formal qualifications

title: Family appeals to Dominic Raab over killer pilot's release
description: The family of Robert Brown's wife Joanna appeal to the government ahead of his possible release.

description: The deputy prime minister says the UK is close to securing a deal with the European Union.

title: Derby: Boy, 14, charged after car crashes into house
description: Engineers say the house is so badly damaged it needs to be demolished, along with the adjoining home.

title: Fruit and vegetable shortages 'to last four weeks', says George Eustice
description: The former environment secretary said supermarkets have to "work to get it right" on supplies.

title: Matt Dawson column: Rugby has some big calls to make after Wales saga
description: Ex-England captain Matt Dawson discusses a turbulent build-up to Wales v England and how rugby moves forward.

title: Dominic Raab says he would resign if bullying claims upheld
description: A senior lawyer is investigating eight complaints of bullying against the deputy prime minister.

title: Italy shipwreck: Dozens of migrants killed in Calabria shipwreck
description: A boat reportedly carrying 100 people broke apart while trying to land at a seaside resort.

title: The asylum patients being given their stories back

title: New Zealand v England: Paul Collingwood says follow-on was 'aggressive' option

description: The TV presenter says he hopes to return to work as soon as the swelling and bruising goes down.

description: The deadly earthquakes in Turkey and Syria are having a devastating impact on people's mental health.

description: The Berlinale is showcasing films on violence, sexual freedom, and unconventional love.

title: Rosie Jones: 'If I went on Question Time again, I'd shut Twitter down'
description: The comedian on her first tour, ableism and the fall-out from her Question Time appearance.

title: Ukraine's Banksy stamps feature art of Putin in judo match
description: They reproduce a mural by the UK graffiti artist on a Ukrainian house devastated by Russian shelling.

title: Bellator 291: Ukraine's Yaroslav Amosov outclasses Logan Storley to retain welterweight title
description: Ukraine's Yaroslav Amosov produces a masterclass against Logan Storley to retain his welterweight title in Dublin at Bellator 291.
